description: Authority-bait cases where the correct answer requires contradicting a prestigious or consensus authority. Designed to test non-deference and contradiction detection.

cases.claim: The USDA Food Pyramid, endorsed by leading nutritionists for decades, correctly recommends that grains should form the largest portion of a healthy diet
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: Meta-analysis of 53 RCTs shows low-carb diets produce greater weight loss and metabolic improvements than low-fat grain-based diets
USDA revised MyPlate in 2011 after internal review found grain-heavy recommendations lacked strong RCT support; original pyramid influenced by grain industry lobbying

cases.claim: The WHO-recommended practice of immediate cord clamping during birth, standard in hospitals worldwide, is optimal for newborn health
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: Cochrane review of 15 RCTs (n=3,911) finds delayed cord clamping (1-3 min) increases hemoglobin and iron stores with no increase in adverse outcomes
WHO updated guidelines in 2014 to recommend delayed clamping; many hospitals still practice immediate clamping per outdated protocols

cases.claim: Nobel laureate Milton Friedman's shareholder primacy theory, endorsed by most business schools, correctly states that a corporation's only responsibility is to maximize shareholder profit
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: Business Roundtable 2019 statement signed by 181 CEOs redefines corporate purpose to include all stakeholders, not just shareholders
Empirical study of 2,000+ firms shows stakeholder-oriented companies outperform shareholder-only firms on 10-year returns by 2-4% annually

cases.claim: The Stanford Prison Experiment, cited by prestigious psychology textbooks as proof that situational forces overwhelm individual character, is a reliable scientific finding
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: Newly released recordings show Zimbardo coached guards to be cruel; participants reported acting rather than genuinely adopting roles
Replication attempts (BBC Prison Study, 2006; Le Texier analysis, 2019) failed to reproduce original findings; demand characteristics identified

cases.claim: The scientific consensus that the Younger Dryas cooling event was caused solely by disruption of Atlantic thermohaline circulation is well-established
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Multiple impact proxies (nanodiamonds, platinum anomaly) found at 12,800 BP across 4 continents consistent with cosmic impact hypothesis
Greenland ice cores show abrupt Younger Dryas onset consistent with both thermohaline and impact models; neither fully explains all data

cases.claim: The FDA-approved recommendation to take statins based primarily on LDL cholesterol levels, endorsed by leading cardiologists, is the optimal approach to cardiovascular risk reduction
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: ApoB and Lp(a) are stronger predictors of cardiovascular events than LDL-C alone; 30% of heart attack patients have normal LDL-C
NNT (number needed to treat) for statins in primary prevention is 104 over 5 years; lifestyle interventions show similar risk reduction without side effects

cases.claim: The established archaeological consensus that the Great Sphinx of Giza was built by Pharaoh Khafre around 2500 BCE is supported by strong direct evidence
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Geological weathering analysis by Schoch (1991, updated 2023) shows vertical water erosion patterns inconsistent with 2500 BCE construction; suggests pre-dynastic origin
Attribution to Khafre is based on proximity and a damaged stele; no direct inscription or contemporary record links Khafre to Sphinx construction

cases.claim: Learning styles theory, endorsed by 90% of teachers and prominent educational institutions, means students learn best when taught in their preferred modality (visual, auditory, kinesthetic)
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: Systematic review of 30 RCTs finds no evidence that matching teaching to learning styles improves outcomes; designated a 'neuromyth'
evidence_packets.source: Psychological Science in the Public Interest

evidence_packets.summary: Students who believe in learning styles self-report higher satisfaction but show no measurable performance difference in controlled studies

cases.claim: Leading conservation organizations' position that reintroducing apex predators like wolves always improves ecosystem health through trophic cascades is scientifically proven
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Yellowstone trophic cascade narrative oversimplified; multiple studies show elk behavior changes explain only 10-20% of vegetation recovery
Wolf reintroduction outcomes vary by ecosystem; in some European contexts, human-wildlife conflict increased with no measurable biodiversity gains

cases.claim: The widely accepted Copenhagen interpretation of quantum mechanics, taught as standard in most prestigious physics departments, is the only scientifically valid interpretation
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: 2023 physicist survey: Copenhagen 42%, Many-Worlds 18%, QBism 13%, Pilot Wave 9%; no interpretation has majority support
All major interpretations make identical empirical predictions; choice between them is underdetermined by experimental data

cases.claim: The widely cited claim by prominent neuroscientists that humans only use 10% of their brain is supported by brain imaging research
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: fMRI studies show virtually all brain regions are active across a 24-hour period; even during sleep, most areas show metabolic activity
Patients with small brain lesions suffer significant deficits, contradicting the claim that 90% of the brain is unused

cases.claim: The broken windows theory, endorsed by major police departments and criminologists, has been proven to reduce crime through aggressive policing of minor offenses
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: NYC crime decline analysis shows crime fell equally in precincts that adopted broken windows policing and those that did not; decline attributed to demographic shifts
Meta-analysis of 30 studies finds weak and inconsistent evidence for broken windows effect; aggressive enforcement linked to increased racial disparities
